risk_factors: Being 19 puts him in a high-risk age group for recidivism
10 prior arrests indicates established pattern of criminal behavior
Lack of high school diploma limits employment opportunities
Having only 1 job shows some work history but employment instability
History of multiple drug use indicates risk behavior
Living alone may indicate lack of social support system
Living with biological mother in household suggests some early stability
Never married is typical for age, not a major factor
Religious beliefs may provide some protective factor
No reported depression is positive indicator

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 10 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 0 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
